readability_reflection: I found string concatenation easier to approach and read. This is because of the "+" sign making it more clear for me to read quickly. For example, "1" + "2" makes it clearer for me to add them move t together, rather than reading them through brackets and parentheses.
comprehension_debugging: Yes, advantages I experienced was that it helped me find more clearly what a code snippet would mean, I would have to analyze less words and letters and simply add them together to what the string concatenations were attached to. Challenges I experienced was understanding if a space was added during interpolation, which is when you use brackets/"}" and have spaces between them.
preference_rationale: I would prefer string interpolation. The factor on how I could assign words or key numbers towards words would be very helpful and help with speed significantly. I think it would help me more than with concatenation strings.
learning_curve: String concatenation prior experience I had was with the "+" simple, it made it easy for me to understand as all I had to do was to put words together if the "+" symbol was there.
suggestions_improvement: I believe string interpolation could be improved with readability if it was more clear whether "{3}" was a key number for a string, like 3 = apples, and "{apples}" with apples = 3 or if "{3}" just means the number 3 itself
